description: The Democratic Republic of the Congo's provincial government of Nord Kivu imposed a 14-day confinement on the eastern city of Goma, effective May 20, 2020. The provisions of which include a police-enforced mandatory curfew from 8:00 pm to 5:00 am. The police have limited movement within city limits by setting up roadblocks as well as by detaining or imposing fines [20,000 to 200,000 Congolese francs ($11 to $110)] on those found in violation of the new curfew.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: No the curfew times are always the same regardless of the day of the week
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: As of September 24, 2020, travelers entering the Democratic Republic of the Congo, regardless of the origin of their travel, are not required to quarantine so long as they show a negative COVID-19 test taken within 72 hours of departure from their point of origin. The DRC Ministry of Health may monitor travelers upon arrival, request information, and order self-quarantine.  They may request travelers take an additional COVID-19 test after arrival.

description: On November 3, 2020, Democratic Republic of the Congo updated exit requirements for international travelers to limit the spread of COVID-19. All departing passengers of age 11 and above must present a negative COVID-19 test from the INRB, or a laboratory approved by the Ministry of Health, from within 3 days prior to departure.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: All countries

description: On November 5, 2020, the Democratic Republic of Congo partially reopens border crossing with Rwanda in order to ease small scale cross border business. The policy also applies to essential workers such as teachers, medics, and students. Travelers must follow health protocols, including rapid tests for COVID-19 before being allowed to proceed to their destinations in a bid to prevent the virus's spread.

description: As of March 24, 2020, in the DRC, all migratory movements are prohibited, by public transport, buses, trucks and other vehicles from the interior to the Capital and from the Capital to the interior. To this end, barriers will be erected by the Governors of Provinces and the crews will submit to strict control in terms of the Coronavirus.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: DRC bans travel between Kinshasa and all other regions in the country.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: All countries

description: As of April 6, 2020, in the DRC, local authorities decided to effectuate lockdown for Gombe district to control the spread of COVID (no mention of a stay at home order, just limits the movement into or out of Gombe)
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more cities within one or more countries

description: As of April 13, 2020, in the DRC, lockdown extended for 14 days in Gombe region, Butembi and Beni (North Kivu province). Individuals are not allowed to enter or leave these cities during lockdown.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: With the March 24 State of Emergency, the President of the Democratic Republic of Congo also imposed a 30-day long ban on all travel to and from capital of Kinshasa  in order to allow the confinement of Kinshasa, the source of the pandemic. UPDATE: On April 23, 2020, the Parliament of the Democratic Republic of the Congo announced the first 15-day extension of the March 24 State of Emergency. Travel to and from the capital of Kinshasa will continue to be prohibited from April 25, 2020 to May 8, 2020.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: Democratic Republic of Congo imposed a 24-hour lockdown on the mining hub of Lubumbashi on April 28, 2020, and was set to shut down Kasumbalesa, a border town on an copper export route, as authorities traced the contacts of a COVID-19 patient.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more cities within one or more countries

date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: The city of Goma in the DRC will be under confinement for 14 days, effective May 20, 2020.  Travel in and out of Goma at city limits will be restricted.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more cities within one or more countries

description: As of July 16, 2020, in the DRC state of emergency is still in place. All domestic passenger flights between Kinshasa and the provinces remain suspended. All road and river transport between Kinshasa and the provinces remain suspended for passenger traffic.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: As of August 4, 2020, in the DRC, travellers moving from one province to another must present a negative coronavirus test result. The test result date must fall within 3 days before the date you intend to leave the province.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Starting from August 15, 2020 interprovincial migratory movements in the DRC resume.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On March 23, 2020, the Democratic Republic of the Congo's provincial government of Haut-Katanga imposed a 2-day confinement on the entire region. The measure was taken after two people who arrived on a Congo Airways plane tested postive for coronavirus arrived to the city of Lubumbashi. This 48-hour confinement was announced in order to trace the other travelers aboard this flight and was enforced by the military and police.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: On 28 March, 2020, the Democratic Republic of the Congo's provincial government of Kinshasa imposed a 3-week confinement on the entire region. The population will be authorized to go out two days per week to purchase food and other basic necessities. Only administrative staff providing minimum services as well as healthcare personnel will be allowed to circulate. UPDATE: On March 27, the provincial government announced it would postpone the total lockdown of Kinshasa.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: On March 26, 2020, the Democratic Republic of the Congo's provincial government of Kinshasa announced a 3-week confinement on the entire region. The population will be authorized to go out two days per week to purchase food and other basic necessities. Only administrative staff providing minimum services as well as healthcare personnel will be allowed to circulate.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description: On 6 April, 2020, the Democratic Republic of the Congo's provincial government of Nord Kivu imposed a 14-day confinement on the cities of Goma, Beni, and Butembo Only vehicles without passengers transporting food and basic necessities are allowed to circulate.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: On April 6, 2020, the Democratic Republic of the Congo's provincial government of Kinshasa imposed a 14-day confinement on the eastern city of Gombe. The measures are enforced by the provincial police with threat of fines and/or imprisonment. Gombe is considered the political, diplomatic and economic hub of the DRC as well as its "epidemic epicenter". Healthcare personnel, journalists and employees of banks and telecommunications services will be allowed to circulate freely while a maximum of 10 persons per company are authorized to enter Gombe.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more cities within one or more countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: On April 6, 2020, the Democratic Republic of the Congo's provincial government of Kinshasa imposed a 14-day confinement on the eastern city of Gombe. The measures are enforced by the provincial police with threat of fines and/or imprisonment. Gombe is considered the political, diplomatic and economic hub of the DRC as well as its "epidemic epicenter". Healthcare personnel, journalists and employees of banks and telecommunications services will be allowed to circulate freely while a maximum of 10 persons per company are authorized to enter Gombe. UPDATE: On April 20, the governor of Kinshasa announces the gradual deconfinement of the commune of Gombe which will begin on Tuesday, April 21. The process of deconfinement will take place as follows: (1) The security barriers of the Congolese National Police in Gombe will remain in place and (2) Banks will be open, as well as food supplies to allow residents to obtain supplies.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more cities within one or more countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: On April 28, 2020, the governor of Haut-Katanga announced a 24-hour lockdown of the mining hub of Lubumbashi to allow for contact tracing of the area's first reported COVID-19 patient who entered through Kasumbalesa on April 24.The governor underlined that the export of minerals will continue uninterupted.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more cities within one or more countries

description: On May 20, 2020, the Democratic Republic of the Congo's provincial government of Kinshasa imposed a 14-day lockdown on the eastern city of Gombe. The provisions of which include a police-enforced mandatory curfew from 8:00 pm to 5:00 am. The police have limited movement within city limits by setting up roadblocks as well as by detaining or imposing fines [20,000 to 200,000 Congolese francs ($11 to $110)] on those found in violation of the new curfew.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description:
On 11 March, 2020, the governemnt of the Democratic Republic of the Congo launched its COVID-19 preparedness and response plan which established a multisectoral response committee for COVID-19 (CMR-COVID-19). CMR-COVID-19 is chaired by the Prime Minister, while the Minister of Health acts as Secretary. It provides the government's policy direction, mobilizes resources and manages funds. 

"The COVID-19 is comprised primarily of the following departments: Interior, Security and Customary Affairs; Health; Finance; Budget; Communication and Media; Transport and Communication Channels; Fisheries and Livestock; Planning; Social Affairs; Humanitarian Actions and National Solidarity; Higher and University Education (ESU); Scientific Research and Technological Innovation; Defense, National and Veterans Affairs; Justice and Attorney General; Primary, Secondary and Technical Education; Environment and Sustainable Development; International Cooperation, Regional Integration and Francophonie; Foreign Affairs."
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
type_sub_cat: New Task Force or Bureau (i.e. establishment of a temporary body)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: The Democratic Republic of the Congo is enforcing a 14-day self-quarantine on passengers having traveled to China, France, Germany, Italy, Iran, South Korea, and Iraq in the 14 days prior to their arrival into the country but who show no symptoms at their time of arrival. Passengers who transited in the countries but did not leave the airport are subject to no restrictions.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: All travelers entering the DRC who have a fever will be tested, and any persons positive for COVID-19 will be hospitalized at DRC government expense. Both categories will be subject to a mandatory 14-day quarantine.  All persons traveling domestically from Kinshasa to other provinces will be subject to preventative screening.

description: In October 2021, the government of the Republic of Congo decided to maintain COVID-19 nationwide restrictions on gatherings or demonstrations of more than 20 people in public and private enclosed areas.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: In October 18, 2021, the government of Republic of Congo decided to maintain COVID-19 restrictions nationwide, prohibiting the organization of indoor mourning and funeral services, and restricting the number of people accompanying the remains to the cemetery to not exceed 50.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: In October 18, 2021, the government of Republic of Congo decided to maintain the COVID-19 nationwide restrictions by obligating churches to reduce the number of participants in worship services and masses to 50 percent while respecting the barrier measures.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Attendance at religious services restricted (e.g. mosque/church closings)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: DRC bans gatherings of more than 20 people on March 18.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: On March 25, 2020, the governor of Haut-Katanga imposes a circumstantial code of conduct on carriers throughout the province by determining the number of passengers to board motorcycles and bikes (2), taxi tricycles - Petita(3), car taxis (4), taxi-bus, (10). medium buses (12) and large buses (20).
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: On April 13, 2020, the governor of Sud Kivu announces the mandatory wearing of a protective mask in public places.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

description: On April 20, the governor of Kinshasa announces the mandatory wearing of a protective mask in public places. Barrier mesaures will be reinforced by the police and army in the rest of the communes of the city of Kinshasa to prevent the spread of the coronavirus.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks in all public spaces/everywhere
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: In December 2020, the government of DRC placed the restrictions on the number of people per vehicle for public transport. This number is unclear

description: In Democratic Republic of Congo, wearing face masks is mandatory in Kinshasa for anyone in public areas. The police will issue fines of 5000 Congolese Francs ($3) if masks are not worn. Wearing facemasks is mandatory in South Kivu.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks in all public spaces/everywhere
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
